data.event: LaPorte is located in northwest Indiana, east of Gary, and west of South Bend and was first settled in 1832.
The current mayor of La Porte, Blair Milo, is one of the youngest mayors in the city's history, elected to the position in 2011 at the age of 28.
The settlement of La Porte was established in July 1832.

event.title: constructed the first sawmill in that year

data.event: Abraham P. Andrew, one of the purchasers of the site, constructed the first sawmill in that year.
The first settler arrived in October, building a permanent cabin just north of what would become the Courthouse square.

event.title: 1833 a Federal Land Office was established

data.event: In 1833 a Federal Land Office was established in La Porte.
The office was moved to Winamac in 1839.
